headline: Micron’s AI Memory Pivot Tests Valuation As US Fab Spending Surges
summary: Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) is reshaping its business around AI infrastructure, exiting most consumer memory products and prioritizing high-bandwidth memory for data centers. The company reports that its high-bandwidth memory supply is already committed through 2026 under multi-year agreements with major AI and cloud customers. Micron is planning up to US$200b in new U.S. fabrication capacity, supported in part by government incentives, to meet long term AI-related demand. For investors...
